comment: Professor Dover is easily my favorite professor I've ever had. The Reformation Europe class was a ton of hard work, but it was so interesting and the lectures felt like watching a movie. Take this class if you can!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Hilarious

comment: He is difficult, but so is the content! He is hilarious and knows the content so well. I'm taking him again this semester!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: DO NOT TAKE! He lectures every class off of a piece of paper and interrupts students who try to discuss with their own thoughts. For assignments, you write epic journals, but he gives no outline or format, then grades extremely harshly and only after will he tell you what he wanted. Very rude as well. Homer was good to read, but not with Dover.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Dr. Dover was by far the best professor I have ever had. Yes, his class was difficult. There was a lot to read, and he was a tough grader on papers. However, I believe that this class truly improved my writing and research ability. His lectures were incredible. If you are willing to put in time and effort, take a class with Dr. Dover.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: You MUST listen to the lectures. There are usually 3 every week and are about 40 mins long each. This was very time-consuming as you also have to read the textbook and do a Past & Present Blog post every week. I never understood grading. The highest grade I received on the essays was an 88 but in my english class I was getting 97s. So idkkkk?
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Dover is very knowledgeable of the topics he covers in class. He also encourages student discussions often. There are also pop quizzes, so make sure you read beforehand. There are 2 papers, a midterm, and a final (both bluebook). If you take the class seriously, you should get an A, but it's not easy by any means.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Prof Dover is extremely smart, and he really encourages discussion. There's quite a few pop quizzes, but they're simple if you've read the material. The midterm was somewhat difficult, and he isn't the easiest grader. He also is kinda slow to respond to emails. However, you will learn a LOT in this class. Put in the work, it's worth it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Inspirational--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Dr. Dover is a brilliant man. He expects his students to be on the same interictal level as him. I found it difficult to follow along sometimes. This is evident through the strict grading criteria. There are 4 (semi lengthy) books you must read and write response papers on (on top of TWO additional textbooks). Lecture. Heavy. Very passionate.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Great at giving lectures. Seems kind of like he'll be a regular Joe professor in the beginning, but you'll warm up to him for sure. I had to read a lot for his quizzes, but his tests and essays were more than easy for me. If you keep up with what you need to do, it'll be more than easy. Don't know why everyone else is complaining. He's a funny guy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Dover is a great guy but he makes his class hard. You're gonna have to work for that grade. He has 2 tests that are short answer and essays only, no multiple choice. He has 2 papers throughout the semester and 12 quizzes over the readings but he drops the lowest 2. 5 absences aloud. He's a good pick if theirs no one else for the class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: This teacher is horrible. He requires an access code and makes us do work every week on mindtap. He makes us take notes in class that doesnt have anything to do with the tests. His tests are impossible and I would never recomend him.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: He gives two test that are 30% then online quizzes/ test that are 25% the final is 20%. So if you bomb the first test your already starting off badly. He give two papers very rough grader. Lectures every class and everything online, and talked about in class will be in each test. No study guides, he just tells you what you should look over.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He makes his tests really hard and tells you to study his lectures but more than half the questions are off the online book and he makes a short answer portion. His study guides for the tests aren't even helpful. He also makes you do essays on books he assigns and grades very harshly. Lecture heavy with no notes, only a very vague outline.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Overall good teacher. Lectures every day. If you pay attention, you'll pass.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: I took him in a small group honors class. We essentially read the books and discussed them. We wrote 4 essays on the books. Grades the essays super hard, but he was willing to look over rough drafts & meet after class to improve them. He is incredibly smart and expects the best out of students. I had to work for my A, but I genuinely learned a lot
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--So many papers

comment: His lectures are kind of boring but he gives you outlines so it's easy to take notes and follow along. 2 in class exams, 2 two page essays, reading quizzes, and the final. If you have more than 6 absences, you get half a letter grade deducted so don't take this as an 8am. Overall good teacher and nice guy.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: One of the best professors I've ever had. Took for Maymester, made long classes interesting, made a point to get to know his students. Highly intelligent, very caring. Fair grader. Provided lecture outlines and clear test guidelines. Very organized. Available outside of class. Great, great teacher. Would 100% take again!
rating_tags: Respected--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Dover is old school. Go to class, take notes, do the assigned reading and you'll be fine. Lectures can be a little dry but he does encourage participation which leads to some interesting discussions. There is a quiz on that day's assigned reading so attendance becomes a priority. No faking your way to a good grade. I learned a lot in this class
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I will say that he... sets "high" standards for students to pass. His tests are brutal, just brutal. (I think more than half the class got 50's on the first test, actually.) On top of that, he gives out pop quizzes nearly every other class.  Overall, his lectures were interesting, but I would never take him again. (Also, way too strict as well!)
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This was by far my hardest class so far.  You have to go to class and take notes and pay attention or you'll struggle really hard with the tests cause they're pretty hard and require lots of studying.  There are lots of quizzes too so if he says read something READ IT. If you do the work you'll do fine, but NOT an easy A.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Very intelligent professor with abstract ideas. He will expect you to read the text and answer questions in class. He has a more lenient attendance policy than other professors, but attendance is still required. I thoroughly enjoyed taking his HIST 1111 class and will look for his classes in the future.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Prof Dover is absolutely awful. He lectures in such an nonconductive way (doesn't tell you what you need to know) Grades his papers super hard like a english class even though all the facts are there. This is a gen ed course and he takes it wayyy too seriously. His tests are hard and he adds an impossible map portion. DO NOT TAKE. you'll wanna  die
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Dover is a very intelligent professor, he went to Yale, and has a PHd from Yale. He doesn't take BS off his students, in other words you can't fake it and not read. He uses the "Socratic Method", of teaching. Meaning he calls on random people. The main reason I did almost all the readings was I hate being embarrassed. Just read. It will be ok.

I use to be good at history until Professor Dover happened. If there is any other option for you to take another professor, do it. This class has a very high failure rate and I consider my final grade a miracle.

This class was all discussion and reading. We had at least 50 pages of reading for every class sometimes up to 100 pages. It was way too much reading for one class. He is also the toughest paper grader I have had at KSU. If he doesn't agree with an opinion in your paper you get points off. Don't take him unless you want to work nonstop for a C.

People who hate on Dover are people who hate doing actual work for their grade. This was the hardest class I've ever taken but I enjoyed it immensely and learned SO MUCH. Dover is ridiculously intelligent and puts a lot of thought into his lectures. All of the students in my class respected him and wanted to impress him. 3 tests, 4 movies, 4 books

Class is all lecture but Dr. Dover knows how to write and perform a lecture. They are like mini speeches. Very inspirational and I don't know if he has written anything but it must be good. The class really opened my eyes and Dover encourages questions and perspective in historical studies. This class made me a better student and historian.

Dover is very intelligent and he expects a whole lot from his students. He is the toughest grader I have ever had at KSU. I did not work as hard as I should have but it was a very demanding class. Attendance counts. I took Dover for research methods and religion.

Prof. Dover is possibly the most boring professor I've ever had. Every lecture consisted of him reading an essay from his podium, droning on for the full class time. He is also surprisingly unwilling to help a student in need. Obey his syllabus to the T, and don't miss any assignments.

Outstanding course from all aspects. Dr. Dover is very effective at instruction, imparting knowledge, and creating good class discussion.  Challenging course, but like other comments my writing and critical reading improved significantly.

Dover is tough. I had to work much harder than in my other classes, but I am a better writer and more critical reader of history because of this class. If you want an easy A, take someone else. If you want to be a better student, take Dover. He is REALLY funny, too!

I thought I wasn't going to like Dr Dover, based on his reputation, but...I LOVE HIM!!! Yes, the guy expects a lot from his students, no doubt. But, I expect a lot from myself, so I really appreciate that about him! He has made me a better writer and a more critical reader of history, plus, he's HILARIOUS. Take him, you'll be glad you did!

Dover is incredibly intelligent and put a lot of work into learning the material himself and preparing lectures.  He expects the same effort from his students. Pretentious, but kind and helpful outside of class. Plan to work hard; don't take if you don't write well (& even if you do, prepare for criticism.  I would take his class again.

DO THE READING, SHOW UP for class, and PARTICIPATE.( I took him in a small class that was discussion based and as a freshman). He is a really tough grader when it comes to his essays, BUT, he will meet with you before the paper is due and tell you what he wants to see. However, I wouldn't want to be in the same room with him alone for very long...

Interesting teacher. Dropped after 4 classes. Multiple choice quiz once a week, lectures went on too long almost missed the class I had after his, hard to really know what was expected on papers. If you are not a history major do not take this class.

I did not like him at all! He is challenging but he goes overboard with undergrad classes. I could see arrogance in the way he grades papers! KSU has tons of GREAT history professors. Dover is not one of them unless you want to feel like doing the amount of work like you are getting a doctorate degree...I would NOT take him!

Professor Dover is a very deliberate and thought provoking instructor. You can tell he devotes much time for preparing class lectures. His grading is fairly critical of History students,but he is an approachabe and very knowlede in terms of World History. Make sure to always come to class, continuously do the readings,and take good lecture notes.

Pretty easy A. Come to class, make an effort to talk in class. Make your essays pretty blatant of the material in class and the books. Expansion on ideas did not help my papers. So stick to the point and don't go over the page limit.

Almost daily easy mult choice quizzes on ass'd reading. Great lectures. Mixed feelings. He's very considerate of students' opinions. Goes out of his way not to offend. He does come across a bit arrogant tho. Don't think you'll breeze thru his class. I'm a junior now and have a 4.0 but I felt like I really worked my butt off for it with him.
He's a hard teacher, but good.  Only real issues with him are constant lateness and a slightly irreverent attitude towards students.

These comments highly underrate Dover. Yes, his lectures are scripted--but he spends an enormous amount of time researching and preparing his lessons. He expects attendance, preparation, and good manners. In return, you  have the privilege of learning from an esteemed scholar. After five courses(all As)with him, I suggest: take every class you can!

A little more than typical emphasis on history of world religions. Tests and assignments were essay form. Professor graded on grammar and punctuation as well as composition on these history essay assignments.

Just do the work and you'll pass the course. I greatly appreciated his fair treatment of all viewpoints brought forth in class, as well as his patience with the need to constantly work with certain students. As far as his lecturing style, whether he reads from a script or not, his lectures are interesting & he seeks student input and participation.
Awesome teacher!
he treats his students like children...take him if you want to feel like you're back in high school

Professor Dover is a very intelligent and witty historian, in my opinion.  If you pay attention to his lectures and keep up with the weekly readings in the books you should be fine.  Sometimes he would offer his own views on history, from his own interpertations.  Above all else, do not show up late to class unless you want to be made an example of

He's a really good professor. People who don't like him are people who expect to not go to class or read the material and offer no points of insight and still get an A (these people are also known as "idiots"). If you're not an idiot, then you should take his class, definitely. He's knowledgeable about the subject he teaches and you'll learn a lot

My favorite professor thus far in my college career. Intelligent, witty and helpful, Dover teaches history as it should be taught -- as a connected narrative rather than unrelated dates and facts. You -will- have to work for that A, but it'll be well worth it and the information will stick with you. Tests 2/3 from notes, 1/3 from textbook.
He is a Butt.  Very smart.  But a butt.  Mature, I know...but I speak the truth.

He is the worst professor I have ever encountered! His students are treated like children, not adults. He seems to fancy himself smart, but his lectures seem like he is reading them from a script in front of him. DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR!!!!!
Treats students as children and not adults.  Berates students for using the restroom during class.  His lectures sound as if they are rehearsed and being read off a script.  He is not helpful at all.

very rude, pompous.. too knowledgeable almost.. expects way too much information to be remembered from his scripted lectures. bad. so boring and just bad. he will call ppl out for going to the bathroom during class.

I found his lectures to be very interesteing. The class is very time consuming though. You have to make sure to do the reading he asks you to do. I never read a thing, and failed 2 out of the 3 tests, but still came out with a C because of the otehr assignments. Make sure you are always on time, don't leave early, and don't sleep in class. He WILL

Lots of reading, 2 map assignments, 1 essay, 2 tests, and 1 final. The tests were fair. Knowledgable professor who knows his history and lectures were not boring. Learned alot but there was alot of work.

Read the assigned chapters in the book and you should do fine.  He's a little boring and takes a little work, but easy A if you just put in a little effort.  I wouldn't necessarily recommend him, but I wouldn't discourage taking him either.

Dr. Dover is very subjective and isn't the most helpful. I would avoid him for Senior Seminar unless you have nothing else going on at the time and can devote yourself to creating the brilliant, Yale-worthy paper that he wants.
I don't understand the negative comments. If you listen carefully, Dr. Dover's accent is easy to understand.

If you do the reading and attend class and take notes and study, an easy C-. Dover is OK. Best trait; the way he connects things in history. Worst trait; the way he goes on talking about his football days at Alabama. He is a good example of what can happen when you take the redneck out of the woods. Textbook is good but expensive, over $180.
I enjoyed this class more than any other history class at KSU. Dr. Dover is a great teacher and scholar.
He's tough! Lots of reading and a strict attendance policy, but he's fun and you'll learn alot.
I took him for a may session and loved the class! take him if you get a chance, you wont regret it!
awesome professor! I would take him again anytime! there is a lot of reading but the class is great! take him!

I also do not understand the negative comments. I think he is great! He doesn't discourage comments in class at all.(Maybe that guy just didn't have anything meaningful to say). There is a lot of reading but he goes over it all and explains every topic very well! He's funny isn't boring at all. Had him in maymester and the 4 1/2 hr classes flew by.
I don't understand all the negative comments below. Dr. Dover has been great for me; I enjoy his class very much. He's interesting, funny, and helpful.

Worst teacher ever. He despises student participation. If you ask a question at the wrong time (he determines when the right time is of course) he gets completely rattled and it throws off his entire scripted lecture. He isn't even clear on what kind of Bibliography he wants but will complain when you don't give him the "right" one.

Dover is an Ivy Leaguer. You have to assume that ALOT more is going to be asked of you. Nobody else in the university can compete with his knowledge of the subject. He's brilliant. Definately hard, but worth it (More D's than A's on exams). Attend Class and participate!  Do not slack! Avoid if not up for a challenge.

The most arrogant, boring man you will ever meet!  There are many great Hist prof's here at KSU, so don't him.  He is very hard, but you don't learn a thing, and your bored to death.  He also openly flirts with very young females (yuke!).  If you want hard but good take D. Fowler.  He is the best!  Slomovitz  and Tate are also great teachers.

He's a really nice guy but I think he just needs to adjust his teaching skills.  His lectures to me aren't interesting at all and his assignments are way too much for this type of class.  He expects you to read all these books in a very short amount of time.  I would NOT suggest taking him. Overall he expects WAY too much for an undergard class.
reminds me of Kermit the Frog when speaking, boring...avoid at all costs!

Unbelievably boring.  His exams require a Blue Book and a lot of writing/essay work.  When grading homework assignments, he should be an English 1102 professor.  Requires homework to be perfect and in MLA style format.  He takes off a lot of points if not done perfect.  My advice is stay away.

He is new there. Would read an essay he typed out for the entire class period so it wasnt very interesting. He ran late many times but also went over time a lot. 5-10 min over. 2 tests, 1 final, maps to color(easy A), 1 book essay, 1 book review
